chart.title: Lung cancer death rates
chart.subtitle: Reported annual death rate from lung, bronchus or trachea [cancers](#dod:cancer) per 100,000 people, based on the [underlying cause](#dod:underlying-cause-of-death) listed on death certificates.
chart.note: To allow for comparisons between countries and over time, this metric is [age-standardized](#dod:age_standardized). All deaths in a country may not have been registered with a [cause of death](#dod:underlying-cause-of-death).

Age-standardized deaths from trachea, br.descriptionShort: Reported deaths from trachea, bronchus, lung cancers in females in those aged all ages per 100,000 people.
descriptionKey: The International Classification of Diseases (Version 10) codes that define trachea, bronchus, lung cancers are C33-C34.
Age-standardized deaths from trachea, br.citationShort: WHO Mortality Database (2025) – with minor processing by Our World in Data
Age-standardized deaths from trachea, br.citationLong: WHO Mortality Database (2025) – with minor processing by Our World in Data. “Women” [dataset]. WHO Mortality Database, “WHO Mortality Database” [original data].

Age-standardized deaths from trachea, br.descriptionShort: Reported deaths from trachea, bronchus, lung cancers in males in those aged all ages per 100,000 people.
descriptionKey: The International Classification of Diseases (Version 10) codes that define trachea, bronchus, lung cancers are C33-C34.
Age-standardized deaths from trachea, br.citationShort: WHO Mortality Database (2025) – with minor processing by Our World in Data
Age-standardized deaths from trachea, br.citationLong: WHO Mortality Database (2025) – with minor processing by Our World in Data. “Men” [dataset]. WHO Mortality Database, “WHO Mortality Database” [original data].
